text: Hrazdan () is the capital of the Kotayk Province of Armenia. The name Hrazdan is from the Middle-Persian name Frazdan which was transliterated as Hrazdan in the Armenian language. Farzdan is connected to the Zoroastrian mythology. With 52,900 people it is the fifth-largest city in Armenia. The town was formed under Soviet rule. During the Soviet years it was one of the highly- industrialized towns of the Armenian SSR. The Hrazdan River is by the town. ==References== Category:Cities in Armenia Category:Capital cities in Europe
title: Hrazdan
